video_description:
http://www.techbargains.com/hp -- Check out the latest coupons and deals for HP products here.

Here's our review of the HP Touchpad. Specs include a 1.2GHz dual core Qualcomm Snapdragon CPU w/1GB of RAM, 32GB of storage, 9.7 inch capacitive screen with a native resolution of 1024x768, twin internal speakers powered by Beats Audio and WebOS 3.0.

Check out http://www.techbargains.com/ for deals and info on the latest technology gadgets.
title: HP Touchpad Video Review (HD)

comments.text: blackberry playbook STOLE from HP's webOS!!  Your statement is flawed.  webOS has been around for over 2 years.  Playbooks OS came out this year and uses the same features (flick, cards, true-mult-tasking) as the﻿ TouchPAD.

comments.author: Cody Bronson

comments.text: Great review. I was one of the luck ones to get the "fire" liquidation of the tablet and everything you stated i agreed with!  Another thing i think that bugs me that you didnt mention is that the inter-graded messenger lags when receiving messages and the buddy list layout unorganized (im using aim).  It isn't the same list﻿ you would see on your regular list on the computer or actual Aim App.
comments.author: XxESKIMOxX

comments.text:
Boot up time is slow due to the update initiation of your cloud profile and connected synergy accounts.  Upon every hard boot-up, the touchpad updates these systems in the background so the﻿ user has the most current information available after the tablet is on and ready to use.

i do appreciate you going though some features that most reviews miss.  webOS is very unique, with it always being connected to the web, speed is compromised but your content is not.  for $99 and $149, it's a must have.
comments.author: ariker01

comments.text: I bought it for $230, and when i compare its price to tabs costing $450-$800, I thought it was a steal... :-P I mean, all we need it for is to check emails and surf﻿ youtube... and oh yea... for porn... :-P  It doesn't have to be a Super-Computer...

comments.text: Upon boot up the TP connects to your webOS cloud profile, updates and syncs the data and then updates all connected Synergy accounts.  This is why boot ups are﻿ more lengthy than other  devices.  With OS updates and 3rd party developers such as webOS internals, this tablet is quite comparable with others.
